info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 1 at 3:01PM EDT until August 1 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg VA
info.description:
FFWRNK
The National Weather Service in Blacksburg has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Carroll County in southwestern Virginia... Southeastern Grayson County in southwestern Virginia... The City of Galax in southwestern Virginia...
* Until 900 PM EDT.
* At 301 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Radar.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Galax... Fries... Fancy Gap... Cana... Pipers Gap... Lambsburg... Woodlawn...
This includes the following streams and drainages... Brushy Fork, Elk Spur Branch, Beaver Creek, Gully Creek, Crooked Creek, Fisher River, Glady Fork, East Fork Little Reed Island Creek, East Fork Crooked Creek, Bull Run, Dixon Branch, Elk Creek, Chestnut Creek and Garners Creek.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on X.
